articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hong Sun Chang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hong Sun Chang 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Saturday sent a wreath to the bier of former Merited Artiste Hong Sun Chang of the National Theatrical Troupe, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Session of Assembly of Heads of State and Government of AU
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Session of Assembly of Heads of State and Government of AU
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to the 26th session of the assembly of heads of state and government of the African Union.
					 The message extended congratulations and greetings to the heads and delegates of the states and governments who participated in the session on behalf of the DPRK government.
					
					 The message said that the AU is now making positive efforts to achieve peace and prosperity in Africa and glorify the dignity of its peoples. It reaffirmed the invariable will of the DPRK government to further develop the good friendly and cooperative relations with the AU and its member states in all fields.
					
					 It wished that the current session would mark a significant occasion in achieving the unity, development, peace and stability in the continent in line with the common desire and interests of the member states.

articles.title: DPRK Accedes to Svalbard Treaty
articles.content:
DPRK Accedes to Svalbard Treaty
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK acceded to the Svalbard Treaty on January 25 according to a decision of its government.
					 Its accession to the treaty provided it with an international legal guarantee for conducting economic activities and scientific researches in the Svalbard Islands.

articles.title: Pyongyang Catfish Farm
articles.content:
Pyongyang Catfish Farm
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Catfish Farm in the DPRK now concentrates its efforts on breeding fry of catfish. 
					 It is striving to raise the hatchability, ensure the water temperature in a scientific way and reduce the standard of feed consumption.
					
					 The farm has paid deep attention to the nutrition care for pedigree catfish in keeping with winter season while increasing the production of catfish and the efficiency of management. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a work goes on at the farm to improve the quality of compound feed and raise its output considerably.

articles.title: Sci-Tech Complex in DPRK Draws Many Visitors
articles.content:
Sci-Tech Complex in DPRK Draws Many Visitors
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Sci-Tech Complex in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, is nowadays crowded with many visitors.
					 According to Ri Mi Yong, a lecturer of the complex, nearly 5,000 people visit the complex every day and most of them are students enjoying their winter vacation.
					
					 Equipped with thousands of computers, the complex is a large comprehensive e-library which can offer enough sci-tech information to any visitor.
					
					 It has various exhibition halls, e-reading rooms, dream hall for children, basic and applied sci-tech halls, ultra-modern sci-tech hall, imaginary science labs and other halls.
					
					 There visitors can deeply grasp the sci-tech principles and methods and have a study of worldwide achievements and data gained in information and nano technology, bioengineering, space technology and other scientific fields. The dream hall for children helps schoolchildren enrich their knowledge.
					
					 The complex was opened to visitors on January 1 with due ceremony.

articles.title: Ryugyong Jangmi Health Complex in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Ryugyong Jangmi Health Complex in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- At the entrance of Mirae Scientists Street in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK there is the Ryugyong Jangmi (rose) Health Complex, an all-round service center for educationists and scientists.
					 The health complex, whose operation started in November last year, offers rose-related welfare service like bathing with rose water.
					
					 The two-storied complex has dry and wet saunas, bathrooms and barber's on the first floor, fitness room, table-tennis room, racket court, beauty parlor and shower room on the second floor and a greenhouse-like dinning room and balcony-style dinning room decorated with roses and medicinal plants on the roof.
					
					 Rose water, rose essence, is very good for moisturizing, whitening, sterilization and prevention of aging. It is also effective for the recovery from fatigue.
					
					 Its manager Pang Jong Chol told KCNA that in March last year supreme leader Kim Jong Un gave an instruction on building a center for serving rose water bath in Mirae Scientists Street and indicated the orientation and ways for its operation. 
					
					 Kim Yong Chol, a teacher of the Kim Chaek University of Technology living at an apartment house in the street, said that he would do his best to make signal achievement in educational work in order to repay the Party's loving care.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Increasing Danger of Nuclear War in Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Increasing Danger of Nuclear War in Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- With no rhetoric can the U.S. cover up its despicable true colors as the most brutal and heinous nuclear criminal, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The U.S. officially announced the introduction of nuclear weapons into south Korea on January 29, 1958 and has since turned it into the world's biggest nuclear arsenal and a source of a nuclear war against the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. has systematically escalated the danger of a nuclear war in the Korean Peninsula, threatening the life and security of the Korean nation and persistently blocking the reunification of Korea. This is the thrice-cursed crime. 
					
					 The nuclear issue in the Korean Peninsula was spawned by the hostile policy the U.S. pursued toward the DPRK, posing a nuclear threat to it. 
					
					 The U.S. turned south Korea into the biggest nuclear arsenal in the Far East and it frantically escalated the moves to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK together with south Korea while threatening its sovereignty and vital rights on the basis of the arsenal. This compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrent in order to defend the supreme interests of the country, peace in the Korean Peninsula and security of the nation. 
					
					 The U.S. and its followers have neither qualifications nor reason to take issue with the DPRK's self-defensive nuclear deterrent as they pushed it to access to nuclear weapons through reckless nuclear blackmail and moves to stifle the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. is chiefly to blame for having escalated the danger of a nuclear war after spawning the nuclear issue in the peninsula while disturbing peace.

articles.title: S. Korean Political Charlatans' Moves for Adopting "Law on Human Rights in North" Ridiculed
articles.content:
S. Korean Political Charlatans' Moves for Adopting "Law on Human Rights in North" Ridiculed
Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- South Korean political charlatans decided to adopt the "law on human rights in the north" at the puppet National Assembly (NA) through collusion. In this regard, the group of traitors are shouting "bravo" over the fact that the curio on which dust had piled on the shelf of the NA for more than ten years has come to be worthy.
					Leading newspapers on Saturday in commentaries ridicule this as a burlesque of those engrossed in such silly acts as visiting a wedding house with mourners' hats made of hemp, steeped in confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					Why did philistines of the ruling and opposition parties of south Korea decide to adopt the above-said law in haste, colluding with each other?
					
					The DPRK is demonstrating its might as the fortress of independence and justice under the banner of Songun and the single-minded unity of all service personnel and people is growing stronger day by day thanks to the policy of attaching importance to the people and respecting and loving them. This reality of the DPRK is throwing the group of traitors into uneasiness and fear. That is why the group is making desperate efforts to tarnish the dignified image of the DPRK at any cost. The group's moves to adopt the law are part of this hysteria and its height.
					
					With no rhetoric can the colonial stooges bring down the most advantageous socialist system of the DPRK which is being defended by all service personnel and people united in single-mind. The political swindlers' ruckus of adopting the law would get them to nowhere.
					
					Minju Joson says that no matter how frequently the political charlatans of the ruling and opposition parties of south Korea may stage such poor burlesques, they can never conceal the genuine reality of the DPRK where the policy of attaching importance to the people and respecting and loving them is in force.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Demands Japan Make State and Legal Reparation for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Demands Japan Make State and Legal Reparation for Sexual Slavery 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Church Women's Federation of south Korea on Thursday made public a statement to denounce the "agreement" on the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to the south Korean CBS. 
					 The statement said that religious women of south Korea hope that the issue of sexual slavery would be solved in a just way. 
					
					 A genuine solution to the issue of sexual slavery is to have Japan make state and legal reparation, not "humanitarian compensation", the statement said.

articles.title: U.S. Story about Threat from North Termed Unreasonable by Canadian Body
articles.content:
U.S. Story about Threat from North Termed Unreasonable by Canadian Body
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Canadian Institute for World Studies posted on its website an article on Jan. 24 terming the U.S. story about "threat from the north's nuclear weapons" unreasonable.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK has long made efforts to normalize the relations with the U.S.
					
					 However, the U.S. has not wanted to normalize relations with the DPRK but persistently sought the hostile ties with it.
					
					 There is enough reason for the DPRK to hate the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK is well aware of the fact that the U.S. has fought endless wars of aggression against many countries to plunder them.
					
					 In the past the DPRK was reduced to debris and millions of innocent people were killed due to the U.S. indiscriminate attacks. 
					
					 The DPRK is making efforts to prevent the repetition of such disasters and defend itself.
					
					 It opted for having access to nuclear weapons as its strategic shield.
					
					 Its nuclear weapons are not for attack but for defence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian, Pakistani Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian, Pakistani Media
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- Russian and Pakistani media made special write-ups on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 An article titled "Kim Jong Il, a great master in independent politics" posted on the website of the Eastern Siberian Publishing House in Irkutsk Region, Russia on Jan. 20, accompanied with a portrait of the smiling leader said:
					
					 His greatest exploit is that he pursued Songun politics.
					
					 He formulated the Songun politics as the main political mode under socialism in the DPRK.
					
					 Thanks to his Songun politics the DPRK's military muscle has been remarkably strengthened and it has displayed its might as a military power any formidable enemy dares not to provoke.
					
					 He consistently raised independence, peace and friendship as the idea of foreign policy and directed deep attention to building a new independent world. He also conducted energetic external activities for consolidating the global independent forces against imperialism.
					
					 The January issue of the Pakistani internet magazine Global Affairs dedicated its two whole pages to an article introducing Kim Jong Il who devoted all his life to the rosy future of the country and people, illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Guinea
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Guinea
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Conakry on Jan. 23.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from Jan. 24 to April 20 and decided to hold a Kimilsungia exhibition, meeting, seminar, photo exhibition and other diverse political and cultural events.

articles.title: Guinean Personage Refers to Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Guinean Personage Refers to Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il) are the most auspicious holidays of not only the Korean people but also world progressives. 
					 Lansana Komara, permanent secretary of the Guinean People's Assembly, said this at an inaugural ceremony of the Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star held in Conakry on January 23. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 I pay highest tribute to President Kim Il Sung and H.E. Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung is the great leader of the Korean people as he devoted all his life to the people. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the great leader in the era of independence who made great contributions to the struggle for the people's happiness and global independence. 
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said it is of great significance for the DPRK and the world to significantly celebrate the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Benin
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Benin
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Socialist Party of Benin for celebrating the 74th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Cotonou on January 25.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan on January 25.
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Karelia of Russia on January 26.
					 Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a seminar, lecture and other colorful political and cultural events praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits between January 26 and February 19.

articles.title: DPRK's Policy Supported by Representative of Chile Political Party
articles.content:
DPRK's Policy Supported by Representative of Chile Political Party
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The representative of the Communist Party of Chile in Cuba made public an open declaration on Jan. 20 in support of the Jan. 15 statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry and the Jan. 14 white paper of the Korean Jurists Committee.
					 The declaration said that through the above-said statement and white paper we have come to know about the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK woven with lie, threat, aggression, distrust and breach of international law. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The above-said statement and white paper brought to the light the unjustifiable attitude of the U.S. sidestepping the DPRK's proposal to conclude a peace treaty and threatening peace in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We extend the most fraternal solidarity and full support to the DPRK's peace policy and all measures for freedom, independence and right to self-determination against the vicious blackmail of the U.S. which raises the stop and abandonment of the former's nuclear development, essential to national defence and independent development, as a precondition for concluding the peace treaty.

articles.title: Slovenian Newspaper Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
Slovenian Newspaper Introduces DPRK 
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- A Slovenian newspaper on January 16 and 18 carried articles introducing the DPRK, illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together. 
					 It said Pyongyang Cold Noodle is one of famous foods of Korea, introducing Okryu Restaurant, Pyongyang Cold Noodle and Korean kimchi. 
					
					 It also introduced insam liquor, special product of Korea, and its medicinal value.

articles.title: Dutch Figure Hails DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test
articles.content:
Dutch Figure Hails DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test
 Pyongyang, January 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's successful H-bomb test proves failure of the policy of the West against it. 
					 The president of the Netherlands-Korea Fund said this in an article hailing the DPRK's first successful H-bomb test contributed to the Dutch newspaper Trouw on January 13. 
					
					 Noting that he has followed with surprise the failure of the policy of the West and the United Nations against the DPRK in the past, he went on:
					
					 They have made a series of attempts against the DPRK including sanctions in a bid to force it to scrap its nuclear program, but it has made more rapid progress 
					
					 The Bush administration's listing of the DPRK as "part of the axis of evil" may be viewed as the starting-point of the nuclear program of the country. 
					
					 Since then the DPRK has reacted to the outsiders' pressure with a tougher stance. 
					
					 The DPRK is undergoing greater difficulties due to escalating pressure and sanctions, but the reality shows that the country can do anything it wants. 
					
					 The solution is to improve the relations with the DPRK. 
					
					 The West is blocking the improvement of the relations with the DPRK, persistently pulling up it over the "human rights issue" and "nuclear threat", but such behavior is very wrong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Hong Sun Chang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Hong Sun Chang
Pyongyang, 30 de enero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio hoy una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Hong Sun Chang, ex actor benemerito del Conjunto Dramatico Nacional, en senal de profundo sentimiento de condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita XXVI Cumbre de Union Africana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita XXVI Cumbre de Union Africana
Pyongyang, 30 de enero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 30 un mensaje de felicitacion a la XXVI Cumbre de la Union Africana.
					En su misiva, el remitente envio en nombre del gobierno de la RPDC la felicitacion y el saludo a los jefes del Estado y gobierno y a los representantes participantes en la cumbre.
					
					Recordo que en estos dias la UA se esfuerza con tesonero por lograr la paz y la prosperidad de Africa y glorificar la dignidad de los pueblos. Y reafirmo la invariable voluntad del gobierno de la RPDC de fortalecer y desarrollar mas vigorosamente en todas las esferas las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la UA y sus paises miembros.
					
					Deseo que la presente cumbre sirva de un motivo significativo en la realizacion de la unidad y el desarrollo, la paz y la estabilidad del continente de acuerdo con la aspiracion e intereses comunes de los paises miembros.

articles.title: RPDC se ingresa al Tratado de Svalbard
articles.content:
RPDC se ingresa al Tratado de Svalbard
Pyongyang, 30 de enero (ACNC) -- La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se ingreso el dia 25 al Tratado de Svalbard de acuerdo con la resolucion del gobierno.
					Como resultado, la RPDC llego a tener la garantia legal internacional que permite desarrollar las actividades economicas y de la investigacion cientifica en las islas Svalbard.
